channel.title: New Video Card
channel.description:
Okay, so as I've made it fairly well known, I just got a new computer. However, the video card in it is pretty much a fail and a half. It's terrible, so I'm looking at new video cards to save up for, and found [url='https://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814130433&cm_re=gtx_260-_-14-130-433-_-Product']this[/url].
It's actually a card my dad bought a long time ago, but wouldn't fit in their computer, so they returned it. But I'm starting to think it wouldn't fit in mine, either. I have a huge amount of open space in the case, but the back plate of the card takes up two slots, which was the problem with the other computer as well. But I've never seen a case with expansion slots two slots wide, so can anyone please explain to me how a double-slot card fits in the expansion slots?

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
I tried both, actually. Without zooming at all.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
CTID:

Max, I attempted to take a picture of the PSU, but the font on the sticker is so goddamn small that my camera won’t focus on it. Sorry…

You’re probably trying to zoom in too much, with that camera you could take the pic from pretty far away and still be able to read it.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
There is a deal on newegg right now. 5850 with a free power supply.

Just in case you were interested.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
You will see a big improve over ur GT220, plus you get DX11. Since the XXX edition is sold out, I would go with the XTreme Edition.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Any recommendations as to which?

Also, if I were to get a 5770, should I expect a significant improvement in performance with games?

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
A 4850 will struggle on FO3 at certain points max’d out, I doubt the 4670 could do it. 5770 is a much better choice if u want good performance without killing ur wallet or ur psu.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: Cup_o_Joe
item.description:
CTID:

Here’s a pic of the back of my computer:

The card itself is actually upside down inside the computer, with the top of the card facing towards where my network card is.

So, would a dual slot card fit?

Also, about the ATi cards, I’ve definitely looked at them, the GTX 260 isn’t my only choice, it’s just the one I picked because I’ve actually handled the card in person.


/\ here is a 5670 card with what seems like a zalman cooler
The best choice would probably be a Radeon 5670 once it comes out, it’s a really good 1 slot card that only takes 55watts (no external power) and is pretty powerful (think, the 4670 could play Fallout 3 at 60fps everything max settings, imagine what this could do). Sapphire will probably make one with the same cooler as on their 4670 cards.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Yeah, it’s an easy enough mistake. There isn’t a floppy drive in here, just a few different SD Card Readers.

EDIT: Also, I found this on a site discussing the fact that you can buy the same computer as I have with a GTX 260 in it, but still with the 350W PSU in it.

Apparently it’s possible but I’m not gonna try it, it’s just to show that there is room in the case.

EDIT EDIT: Also, yes, I’m aware that’s a GTX 280.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
Didn’t even notice the HD1 lable. Assumed it was floppy drive bay. My bad.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: Nirvash
item.description:
He can move the HDD to HDD1 above it.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
Perhaps it is a trick of the angle, but a GTX 260 will extend past the edge of the motherboard by just over half an inch ( including the gpu cooler sheath ). From that picture there isn’t enough separation between the board and that vertical HDD. Unless there is room for the card to rest under the HDD, but from the angle, it doesn’t look like the case is that deep.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Not to sound too persistent or anything, but I’m positive that a GTX 260 would fit in there. Because you can buy the computer with a 1792MB GTX 260.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
Well a GTX 260 won’t fit in there. I doubt a 4890 would either. I do suggest the 5770 at this point. You likely won’t even need a new power supply unless it is REALLY bad.

Read full topic

§pitƒire:

Learn about computers before buying one.
Think of it as buying shoes, you should know your size first, or else you may end up buying shoes 3 times too small for you.

EDIT:

I concur though, I’ve had an 6800gt by Club3D, never had any problems with it for the 6 years I used it.

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
CTID:

Still would need a new PSU.
Damn you, Dell.

What PSU does your machine have? Can you take a screenshot of the sticker on it?

I also have had bad luck with saphire as a brand. I have had two over the years with sub par fans.

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: eternalness
item.description:
Yeah i have two XFX 4890s and there great, steer clear of the saphire vapor-x ones tho, if ur goin with the 4890, cause my two came defective.

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: Tohdman
item.description:
I would suggest the 5770 also. Since it’s shorter and consumes less power than the 4000 series. For with XFX for sure, the have a great warranty.

Put your rig through a power supply calculator and see if it can handle a 5770. I have 4890’s in my system and they are good cards. I got a defective batch but the one you posted is a lot better. The cooler looks awesome IMO.

Read full topic

item.title: New Video Card
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
Hazzmat:

Get the HD 5770. Not too expensive and a great card. I’m using one myself and I have no issues with it.

Same for me, I can run every single game that I own at Maximum without a hitch and it only cost me 200 bucks.
